alert.note: Alert for Los Angeles (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 28 at 9:28PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest California, including the following county, Los Angeles. * WHEN...Until 1130 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Heavy rainfall could trigger shallow debris flows in and near recent wildfire burn scars. There will be widespread ponding of water on area roadways and local flooding of low lying areas and intersections. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 923 PM PST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated moderate to heavy rain. Rainfall rates were up to one third of an inch per hour. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Moderate to occasionally heavy rainfall will continue to produce minor flooding through the late evening hours. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Long Beach, eastern Malibu, Acton, Alhambra, Altadena, Pasadena, Downtown Los Angeles, Griffith Park, Whittier, Burbank, Hollywood, Universal City, Inglewood, West Covina, Beverly Hills, North Hollywood, Culver City, Glendora and Torrance. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Move away from recently burned areas. The rain will likely trigger shallow mud and debris flows, minor rock falls, and flooding capable of localized damage, especially in steep terrain in and near burn scars.
